result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler C. Morger

records.addlTxt:
3:41 PM - cases called - 22CM49, 22CF143 and 22CF151.  Defendant Tyler C. Morger in court.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach in court for Tyler C. Morger.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding plea agreement.  Court questions Atty Fehrenbach/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Fehrenbach/Defendant.  Court finds a waiver of the preliminary hearing in 22CF143 is free and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings in 22CF143.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Defendant acknowledges the restrictions that go along with a felony conviction.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Joint recommendation.  Statement by Atty Polzin/Atty Fehrenbach/Court regarding sentencing.  Post conviction rights given.  

22CM49 - DRI

22CF143 - Plea to Count 2 is guilty.  Plea to Count 3 is guilty.  Count 1 - DRI.  Court orders on Count 2 - 120 days in the Lincoln County Jail with Huber (imposed and stayed).  Court further orders 1 year probation with conditions of probation being absolute sobriety - may not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages, may not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol, AODA assessment and compliance with treatment recommendations and cc/sc.  Court orders on Count 3 s/w 2 years probation with conditions of probation being the same as Count 2.  13 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.  Court directs any cash bond be applied to cc/sc.  

22CF151 - DRI
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court accept waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.  May not enter any premises licensed for the sale or service of alcohol.

1:31 PM - case called.  Defendant Tyler C. Morger appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Defendant.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
